fullDescription.intro: Resizes the image in each dimension. The resulting values at each position in the image are set according to the resizing strategy. Please note, that the input values for each dimension can be interpreted in several ways.

tab.name: Options
tab.option:
Determines the strategy, how to fill the resized image.
Linear Interpolation: Pixel values are linear interpolated.
Nearest Neighbor Interpolation: Pixel values are interpolated according to their neighbors.
Lanczos Interpolation: Pixel values are interpolated using lanczos interpolation.
Periodical Extension: Pixel values are repeated periodically.
Border Extension: Pixel values on the border of the image are repeated.
Fill with Minimum Value: Fill pixel values with minimum value of the input image.
Fill with Maximum Value: Fill pixel values with maximum value of the input image.
Fill with Zero Value: Fill pixel values with zero value of the input image.
Remark: Extensions and Filling Strategies are only useful in the case that the output image is larger than the input image.

option.name: New Dimension Sizes
option.p: Specify here the size of the resulting image for each dimension. If a dimension doesn't exist in the image at hand the according dimension will be ignored. There are three different ways of how the dimensions of the result images will be calculated with respected to the specified values for each dimension:

ol.li:
Absolute Image Size:
Size of the resulting image for each dimension. Output dimension = specified value.

Scaling Factor:
Factor to scale dimensions of input image for each dimension. Output dimensions = input dimension * specified value.

Calibration:
Input values are interpreted as the new calibration values. For example, this is useful for arbitrarily calibrated images, to enforce, that the calibration in each dimension is one. Due to rounding errors, the resulting calibration will only approach this definition (depending on the image size). Output dimensions = ((calibration of input image) / (specified value)) * (input dimension).
